result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor N. Polar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Taylor N. Polar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Taylor N. Polar was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Taylor N. Polar was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor N. Polar

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor N. Polar appears via video from FC jail, in court is his attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:16 PM. Here for return on warrant. Cirilli has complaint, waives further reading and asks court to set for PH. Court questions Polar. State has extended offer to Cirilli and discusses with client. Polar would like to take the offer. Recess 2:21 PM for attorney to go over form with Polar. Re-called 3:36 PM. Same appearances, Polar now appears in person, in custody. State reached agreement and recites agreement, count 1 would be dismissed, count 2 plead to as alleged, count 3 amend to misd. bail jumping. Asking for time served. Cirilli and Polar agree. Court dismisses count 1 and amends count 3 to misd. bail jumping. Polar enters NC plea to count 2 as alleged and NC to amended charge in count 3. Court has PLQ and goes over form with defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks for a time served of 52 days. Cirilli makes final statement and asks for time served as well. Polar with holds comment. Court proceeds to sentencing: Count 2 & 3 - 52 days in FC jail with 52 days served, costs on each count, 60 DTP/CO, must submit DNA sample with expunction rights given. Appeal rights given.
Return on warrant on July 11, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:47 AM. Cirilli asks for an adjourment for stated reasons. State requests forfeiture of any bond posted and bench warrant, body or $1,000.00. Cirilli verbally rejects to forfeiture of bond. Court forfeits bond posted, a hearing will be set, issues bench warrant, body or $500.00.
Return on warrant on April 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:09 AM. Cirilli not sure where client is. Cirilli asks for an adjourment for stated reasons. State  - did have a resolution - asks for bench warrant. Court issues bench warrant, body or $300.00.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor N. Polar in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Taylor N. Polar in custody via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:28 AM. Court quashes the warrant as he is in custody. Cirilli and Polar have complaint, waives reading of it, defendant is requesting a PH. Court asks defendant why he was not in court on 11/18/15. Polar states he was in Brown County Correctional Facility. State - bond - no objection to signature bond. Cirilli - no objection to signature bond and will waive time limits for PH. Court - bond - $3000.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, considers time limits waved. Court sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 01-27-2016 09:30 am
Notification of Warrant Detainers - Brown County

Defendant Taylor N. Polar not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:27 PM. State advised that the defendant posted out today and not sure if he knew of this date. Court reviews file, defendant should have been aware of today's date as he was in court when it was given. State asks for forfeiture of bond and warrant for $2500.00. Court forfeits bond, issues bench warrant body or $2500.00

Defendant Taylor N. Polar in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:54 PM. Polar does not have complaint. State will send one over with the bailiff in Court (Al Thompson). Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Polar understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, not eligible for SPD, states he has Gary Cirilli on another matter in Oneida County, will try and contact Mr. Cirilli. Court continues bond, sets for AIA. Court gives ramifications of returning without an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
